/blog/bits2bricks/custom-syntax-pcb.d: bridging markup syntax and hardware notation.

/blog/bits2bricks/TEST_BITS2BRICKS.d: a technical showcase of every markdown extension — text formatting, typed blockquotes, code blocks, tables, images, and links. the accent color here is blue.

/blog/bits2bricks/openclaw-containment-p.d: Step-by-step guide to running OpenClaw safely using containers, VMs, network segmentation, and cloud deployment. Every technique ranked by effort and protection.

/lab/projects/my-project-slug-2.d: Built a local auto-scaling load balancer that spins instances, health-checks, and routes traffic based on load — shipped in ~4 hours.

/lab/projects/infraphysics-web-2.d: 18 days, 132 commits, one systems engineer who doesn't know CSS, and the website that somehow came out of it.

/lab/projects/infraphysics-web.d: How a systems engineer built a personal site with a custom markdown compiler, a second brain, and an AI development partner — and what went wrong along the way.

/lab/projects/finboard.d: A vanilla JS investment dashboard built in one session with Claude 4.6. No framework, no build step, no npm install. Just a folder you double-click.

/blog/threads/anatomy-of-a-markdown-comp.d: how custom syntax coexists with standard markdown.

/blog/threads/TEST_THREAD.d: a complete showcase of every markdown extension available in this system — text formatting, blockquotes, code blocks, images, links, and more.

/blog/threads/transformers-and-the-data-.d: Why the transformer architecture refuses to stop getting smarter — and what stands in its way.

/blog/threads/everything-is-a-pipe.d: roman aqueducts, your bloodstream, and TCP/IP all solved the same problem. none of them knew about the others.

/blog/threads/why-rust-exists.d: ownership, borrowing, and the compiler that won't let you hurt yourself.

/blog/threads/alignment-is-not-a-vibe-ch.d: Billions of dollars, thousands of researchers, and one very uncomfortable discovery about what happens when you teach a model to pretend.

/blog/threads/autopsia-infraphysics-web.d: un análisis brutal del artículo del proyecto infraphysics-web: qué suena a IA, qué aburre, qué está desequilibrado, y cómo volverlo humano.

/blog/threads/openclaw-and-the-keys-to-y.d: An AI agent with full access to your computer sounds amazing until you think about it for five minutes. This is about what that phrase actually means.

/blog/threads/everybody-has-an-opinion-o.d: The real AI bubble isn't in the stocks. It's in the takes.
